You were in a Kelly green dress, sunglasses and a hat on Sunday on the path along Shore Line Dr. and in Crown Beach Park.  I am in my early fifties, I was wearing a hat and sunglasses.  I walked by you on the path, jazz blaring out of the bluetooth speaker in my backpack.  I passed you and stopped to sit on a bench further on.  You came to the bench and sat down to put on your sexy snakeskin shoes.  We spoke to one another.  I have no idea why I didn't ask for your name or number.  If it's you, what was I wearing and what did we talk about?

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
You had a cool looking hooded jacket on, about 30 feet out we locked eyes.  You removed your hood and I got a clear look at your beautiful eyes, hair style, tattoos and piercings.  I was caught of guard for a moment, I wanted to tell you that you looked beautiful.  But instead I asked you for a high 5.  You smiled and gave me the best high five I have had all day.  You are a beautiful punk rock chick and I just look like a geek.  I wanted to ask you to hang out sometime, but the cross walk was telling me that it was time to keep walking...  

In the even that you see this and actually want a second chance to make that connection,
Start by telling me your name,
what I was wearing,
and on or about what street we were crossing.

Best wishes
title: High 5 on Mission

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Me: Yesterday, Wednesday May 23 just before 5pm, parking on Mountain blvd in front of the Rite-Aid in Montclair. The car driving behind me barely left me enough room to parallel park and may have even almost backed in to the car behind them trying to give me room. I skillfully made the tight squeeze into the parking spot and I suggested that person "give a little more room!" for people trying to park as they drove by. 

You: were parked in the spot directly in front of the spot I parked in. You must've witnessed this slight parking challenge while walking by and came up to me to offer the remaining 20 minutes on your parking meter as you were about to drive away. I'd been spending quite a bit of time thinking on kindness recently and expressed my gratitude for the kind act, saying "it really made my day" or, "I really needed that today." You were already walking back to your car as I said this but turned on a dime when I said that and pulled a card out of your wallet and handed it to me. It was a quote that said, "Don't worry - be happy."

Well I HAD been mired in worry and fear off and on that day and for a couple days before. I quickly said, "This is so serendipitous! I've been tripping and worrying all day. Thank you!!" I think you smiled and drove off.

And someone else immediately pulled into your parking spot with the 20 minutes on the meter as I sat in my car in shock and bewilderment. That 20 minutes on the meter was nothing compared to the kindness you showed when I was feeling especially stressed. That quote (by Meher Baba) was EXACTLY what I needed right at that moment.

I went on with the errands I needed to run, still taken aback at what had happened. For some reason I was delayed on each of these errands but, instead of feeling impatient and annoyed (unfortunately often the norm for me), I was patient, confident that there were many lessons to be learned from my afternoon in Montclair. Because of this patience, I made more eye contact and smiles with passers by and engaged in more conversation than I usually do while interacting with people in the village. 

The afternoon and interactions were blessings! Your kind gestures gave me a lot to focus on and when I have the "attitude of gratitude," my day always seems to go better. 

Thank you!
title: Awesome serendipity in Montclair wednesday afternoon

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Please don't flag this...


For many years I was wanting to get to know you. But I was in a relationship the entire time. I was happy, but something about you captured my curiosity, and I would even come in for no reason, but to see you. 
Something would raise the hair on my skin, everytime I would walk towards the door, knowing I was about to maybe, be called to your line. Would I find the courage? Too ask you anything, letting you know I wanted, to know you. Why must you sit through bullet proof glass, so pleasantly smiling, with a soft, comforting voice, long, long black with a hit of red hair, and cute kissable cheeks :). It's intimidating lol. Would you, do you, will you, take the chance to smile with your eyes, when ours meet. Do you think I am different, as I do about you? I have not forgot about you, do you recognize me when I show up? Boy, do I hope so. I think you know I am interested, I mean, I glance over to you a handful of times, trying to give you the hint, like "hi :)".

To N.R,
from the shy guy with gauge earings and orange lensed glasses :)

-A
title: Wells Fargo - m4w

I am E.Indian, divorced, early 50s.  I don't see myself following strangers on the street, however strong the attraction.  That would be creepy, wouldn't it?  I don't even know if you are single, available, and open to dating Indian men.  But what have I got to lose by posting here?  Another missed connection?  What are the chances that our paths will cross again?  If you think this might have been you, please respond with the approximate time that this could have happened.  And the kind of business that is a few steps away at the S/E corner of Polk/Pine.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
so you've been our UPS guy for a month or two now and the days you deliver those beautiful brown boxes are the best days of my week.  

you mentioned that you try to time deliveries to our medical building around noon so you can use the elevators with impunity.  this is a good tactic and i want to approve, but your choice has rendered a situation where you always and only see me when i am stuffing meats and cheeses into my face.  though, to be honest, this is not exactly a misrepresentation of me as a person.

you've got short brown hair, you're really smiley, and i have a sneaking suspicion you've got a killer body under that standard-issue UPS frock.

today we found out that we both like cloudy weather better, because neither of us likes being sweaty.  but, frankly, i'd feel just fine working up a sweat with you.

i always try to make a little small talk, but i never want to take up too much of your time or make you uncomfortable; that said, i would *love* to ask you out for a beer and get to know you better.
title: UPS Delivery Guy  m4m
